content:
Both Strava and Runkeeper have features that allow you to share your jogging routes with others, making it easy to plan and coordinate your runs with Rachel.

**Strava:**

1. **Route Sharing:** You can share your routes with Rachel by sending her a link to the route on Strava. To do this, go to the "My Routes" tab, select the route you want to share, and click the "Share" button.
2. **Club Feature:** You can create a private club on Strava and invite Rachel to join. This way, you can share routes, plan runs, and track each other's progress within the club.
3. **Live Tracking:** Strava offers live tracking, which allows Rachel to see your location in real-time during your run. This feature is available on the Strava mobile app.

**Runkeeper:**

1. **Route Sharing:** Runkeeper allows you to share your routes with friends via email, Facebook, or Twitter. To share a route, go to the "Routes" tab, select the route you want to share, and click the "Share" button.
2. **Friend Feature:** You can add Rachel as a friend on Runkeeper, which allows you to see each other's activities, including routes and progress.
3. **Live Tracking:** Runkeeper also offers live tracking, which enables Rachel to see your location in real-time during your run.

Both Strava and Runkeeper have mobile apps, so you can easily access these features on your smartphone.

By sharing your jogging routes and using live tracking, you and Rachel can ensure you're both following the same route and meet up at the trailhead without any issues.

Give these features a try and see which one works better for you and Rachel!
